page.title: 06FARMING IN NEWTOWNARDS
page.content: About 6 farmers work the 400 acres used for agriculture in our area. Grass covering 300 acres is used for livestock, 200 acres are grazed by 250 beef cattle. Dairy farming comprises 100 acres with 80 - 90 cows, each producing over 1000 gallons of milk a year. The vegetables grown on 30 acres include cabbage, cauliflower, carrots and pamphrey. Cereal crops cover 30 acres: 10 acres in winter barley and 20 acres in spring barley. Potatoes are grown on l2 acres. Flax is a crop recently re-introduced in the area due to new labour saving harvesting methods and covers 20 acres but is increasing annually. Ards Malting Company serves as a receiving depot for farmers in surrounding areas who grow malting barley. There it is made into malt which is later transported to Bushmills for whiskey making.
